comment: I enjoyed this class and her as my instructor. Fun class, learn at your own pace!
One of the best professors in the IT department. She gives good feedback, and the work is good.

Very boring class.. All she does is read through a PowerPoints all class. Reading is super easy assignments were easy but besides the boringness of it she seems like a great professor. 4 Major test throughout the semester that were taken in class and she allows notes on some of them.

One of my favorite teachers yet. Understands that students have jobs and a life outside of the class, so she helps if you start falling behind. Lots of the assignments are done in class together and the quizzes were unlimited attempts. Wasn't afraid to help during or after class if you got stuck. Test were in person, but unlimited notes! Awesome!!!

She was not the greatest. Her assignments are all over the place, and she randomly assigns discussion questions. The labs and quizzes are the easiest part. The non-lab homework sucks and takes forever, and her instructions can be unclear and confusing. She responds pretty quick and is willing to help. Her organization skills are just terrible.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She uses lectures given by other teachers as her resources and did not teach anything at all. I basically took another professor with her as the middle man. Easy grader, though, and very understanding. She opens some assignments after the due date if you ask nicely.
Super nice, very helpful, and kind at heart. She'll work with you.

Professor Vinaykumar is a lenient grader, and you can reach her outside of class. I emailed her asking multiple questions and about an hour later she replied and answered all of them. Only downside for the class was there were about 5 assignments total and a group research paper. Assignments were easy, milestones a little more difficult.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Really enjoy having this professor. Everything such as grading, scheduling, and expectations are very clear. The notes are organized and the information is all very helpful. Sometimes it is hard finding a good professor for these courses. Thankful to have found one that is helpful and understanding this semester.

Attendance was extra credit. This class is smooth sailing if you have a group that is serious about putting in the time. Definitely ask clarifying questions. Her lecturing skills need work. Read the slides before class. Very organized modules. Lots of group assignments. She's a nice lady.

The instructor is very clear and makes sure that the students understand what they are assigned to do. She is always there when needed. This class is very interactive; a huge chunk of your final is based on your group assignments. If you follow the instructor's instructions; this class is an easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Get ready to read

comment: This class is basically built around group projects and individual assignments. The entire semester you are in the same group working. And each week either a discussion, individual assignment, or group assignment is due . It is a very easy A just do the work. You don't even have to go to class. Just if your in a group stay on top off it.

Textbook was online and free. Some topics were hard to understand but she tries help students understand the best she can. This class felt like a fluff class because i'm not going to use most of the info given. Not hard at all she's nice and lenient. Gives extension on assignments to give you time to understand. I'd take her again.

She's very nice and accessible. She responds to emails quick. Organized. This was a hybrid class so attendance wasn't mandatory but she was going to give extra credit to those who showed up at the end of semester. The material consist of links to w3 and some powerpoint. It was an easy class for me. Gives extensions when necessary.
She is a very good teacher, very lenient and e-mails very quickly. She provides all the information so you really do not have to do much.

This was her first semester teaching and she did a great job at it. This class is mostly based around group projects and then an occasional test. The tests were kinda hard because you dont get very long to take them. I barely finished each one with maybe 4 minutes left. But solid decision for a professor for project management
